hero.name: Roland Nemes
hero.summary: Entry-level DevOps Engineer passionate about building reliable, automated, and scalable infrastructure. I bring strong AWS, Kubernetes, and Linux skills, combined with a unique background in language and technical communication. My DevOps journey began with personal projects that solved real deployment and automation challenges. I’m committed to bridging development and operations through clean workflows, clear documentation, and continuous improvement.
hero.location: Based in Romania / EU – open to remote or hybrid roles in Hungary & Romania.

description.problem: Manual infrastructure setup was slow and prone to error.
description.solution: Built a production-ready AWS CloudFormation template that deploys a scalable Kubernetes cluster (EKS) with integrated monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana) and automated CI/CD via AWS CodePipeline and GitHub.
description.result: Zero-downtime deployments and reduced provisioning time from hours to minutes.
description.learned: Deepened skills in infrastructure-as-code and automated workflows.

description.problem: Existing CAT tools feel bloated and unintuitive for some translators.
description.solution: Design and develop a cross-platform CAT tool with a clean interface, secure authentication, and powerful import/export features.
description.result: Creating a leaner, more efficient workflow for translators.
description.learned: Full-stack architecture, secure authentication flows, and UI/UX optimization for productivity.

description.problem: Needed a sandbox to practice full-stack CRUD operations and authentication.
description.solution: Built a Reddit-style app with Next.js and SQLite, featuring user authentication, posts, and comments.
description.result: Functional platform with user authentication, posts, and comments.
description.learned: Handling user data securely, building responsive UIs, backend form validation.

description.problem: Needed to understand backend API design for commerce workflows.
description.solution: Developed an Express-based backend for product management, shopping cart, and checkout.
description.result: Modular, scalable backend ready for frontend integration.

description.problem: Repeated Arch Linux setups wasted time.
description.solution: Wrote a Bash script to automate installation and configuration.
description.result: Reduced setup time dramatically and ensured consistent environments.
description.learned: Shell scripting best practices and Linux automation.

description.solution: Maintained a central repository of dotfiles and config scripts.
description.result: Consistent workflows and faster environment setup.

events.text: Began learning the Linux OS and shell scripting.
Started learning cloud computing with AWS; built first CI/CD pipeline.
Deployed Kubernetes clusters on AWS EKS; learned monitoring with Prometheus & Grafana.
Started developing BaseCAT with full-stack architecture.
